summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for July 13, 2019. It details the required irregular observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, with staff signatures for each check. The document is significant as it represents the standard operating procedure for inmate monitoring at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

events.title: Inmate Observation Rounds at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Continuous 30-minute observation checks were conducted throughout the day for inmates held in the Special Housing Unit under administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, as documented on multiple check sheets.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets detailing 30-minute inmate observation checks for July 13, 2019.
It outlines the Bureau of Prisons policy requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The checks were conducted in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), which is used for administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.
Multiple sheets (labeled ZB, ZA, L-Tier, M-Tier, ZA Tier-J, ZA Tier-K) indicate checks were performed across different tiers or units.
The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight for inmate monitoring procedures.
